title: Revenue Accounting Manager
content:
About Pinterest:  
Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.
Creating a life you love also means finding a career that celebrates the unique perspectives and experiences that you bring. As you read through the expectations of the position, consider how your skills and experiences may complement the responsibilities of the role. We encourage you to think through your relevant and transferable skills from prior experiences.
Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that’s uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our PinFlex landing page to learn more. As the Japan Revenue Accounting Manager, you’ll hold the key accounting position in Japan and will play an important role in shaping the future operations in the region. You’ll work closely with our Sales, Sales Finance, Legal, IT and other accounting teams to build and drive process improvements, including for our advertising Partners. As the revenue manager in Japan, you will have the opportunity to shape the vision and build our revenue accounting operations in the region (APAC). You’ll offer insights and make recommendations to improve our operations, while working to transition (as appropriate) our order management, monthly close and credit & collections operations for APAC.
 
What you’ll do:

Support the daily revenue accounting operations, order processing and credit & collections, for APAC region, consistent with our global processes
Manage a small team locally
Advise the multiple cross-functional stakeholders in this new region launch on best practices in Japan
Maintain and perform local revenue operations, accounting and reporting, including relevant SOX controls
Coordinate between XFN partners and accounting team to ensure accuracy and timely support, in particular building strong relationships with sales leadership in the region
Recommend processes changes, systems and workflow automation

 
What we’re looking for:

5+ years of accounting experience, tech company experience preferred
Prior people management experience preferred
Self-motivated and able to work independently
Strong understanding of accounting operations, local regulations and taxes in Japan
Prior experience collaborating with legal, sales, and other cross-functional teams
Experience with Salesforce.com, Google Suite or similar systems
Strong Excel skills are a must, experience with Tableau, SQL or similar are a plus
Public accounting certification and Big 4 or other public accounting experience is preferred
Strong proficiency in English & Japanese

 
This position is not eligible for relocation assistance.

We’re looking for all kinds of people.

To build an app that’s used and loved by people all around the world, we need a team with all kinds of different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds.
